short_summary: Diving Inspections for various locations in Newfoundland and Labrador
description: This procurement is seeking a contractor to perform diving inspections and minor repairs on marine structures and facilities at various locations in Newfoundland and Labrador...
full_summary:
### [Contract Title]
**EA003-241787 RISO Diving Inspections - Various Locations in Newfoundland and Labrador**

### [Contract Description]
Public Services and Procurement Canada is seeking Regional Individual Standing Offers (RISO) for diving services to conduct inspections and minor repairs on marine structures and facilities at multiple locations in Newfoundland and Labrador. The contracting authority intends to award up to 3 standing offers, each spanning a 2-year term, to contractors on an "as and when requested basis".

### [Contract Details]
- **Posted On**: April 29, 2024
- **Closing Date**: June 5, 2024, at 2:00 PM EDT
- **Contract Amount**: Up to $40,000.00 (including HSTI) per individual call-up
- **Trade Agreements**: This tender is subject to various trade agreements, including CETA, CPTPP, and WTO GPA.

### [Locations of Work]
- Newfoundland and Labrador

### [Contracting Authority]
- Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
- 11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau, QC K1A 0S5, Canada

### [Contact Information]
You can contact:
- Grace, Hannah (SPAC/PSPC)
- Phone: n/a
- Email: [hannah.grace@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:hannah.grace@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)

To access the tender notice, please visit the following URL: [https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/19549141?extsite=MTk1NDkxNDFfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==](https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/19549141?extsite=MTk1NDkxNDFfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==)

Note: The "expires" status flag has been removed as it was mores of a historical note. Also the bid document does not seem to follow the Canadian bilingual format. To respect this and your request for a rephrased document I added the languages up to the documents details but avoided using them excessively for length and format reasons. Let me know if you have any other questions or concerns.
